      #include <stdio.h>
      #include <stdlib.h>
      #include <stdbool.h>
      #include <string.h>

      #define MAX_SIZE 100010

      bool prime[MAX_SIZE];

      void init_sieve() {
          // Initialize the prime array
          for (int i = 0; i < MAX_SIZE; i++) {
              prime[i] = true;
          }
          prime[0] = false;
          prime[1] = false;
          for (int i = 4; i < MAX_SIZE; i += 2) {
              prime[i] = false;
          }
          for (int i = 3; i * i < MAX_SIZE; i += 2) {
              if (prime[i]) {
                  for (int j = i * i; j < MAX_SIZE; j += i) {
                      prime[j] = false;
                  }
              }
          }
      }

      int main() {
          init_sieve();

          int N, M;
          scanf("%d %d", &N, &M);

          if (M % 2 != 0) {
              int X = -1;
              for (int i = X; i < 100008; i++) {
                  if (i < 0) continue;
                  if (i >= MAX_SIZE) break;
                  if (prime[i]) {
                      printf("%d\n", i);
                      return 0;
                  }
              }
              // Fallback: should not happen for X=-1
              printf("2\n");
          } else {
              if (M == 0) {
                  int X = 0;
                  for (int i = X; i < 100008; i++) {
                      if (i >= MAX_SIZE) break;
                      if (prime[i]) {
                          printf("%d\n", i);
                          return 0;
                      }
                  }
                  printf("2\n");
              } else {
                  // Build graph
                  int *degs = (int*) calloc(N, sizeof(int));
                  int **edges = (int**) malloc(N * sizeof(int*));
                  int *sizes = (int*) calloc(N, sizeof(int));
                  int *capacities = (int*) malloc(N * sizeof(int));
                  for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
                      edges[i] = (int*) malloc(2 * sizeof(int)); // start with capacity 2
                      capacities[i] = 2;
                      sizes[i] = 0;
                  }

                  for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
                      int a, b;
                      scanf("%d %d", &a, &b);
                      a--; b--;

                      if (sizes[a] == capacities[a]) {
                          capacities[a] *= 2;
                          edges[a] = realloc(edges[a], capacities[a] * sizeof(int));
                      }
                      edges[a][sizes[a]++] = b;

                      if (sizes[b] == capacities[b]) {
                          capacities[b] *= 2;
                          edges[b] = realloc(edges[b], capacities[b] * sizeof(int));
                      }
                      edges[b][sizes[b]++] = a;

                      degs[a]++;
                      degs[b]++;
                  }

                  // Find candidate node: smallest non-zero degree, then smallest index.
                  int min_deg = 10000000;
                  int candidate = -1;
                  for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
                      if (degs[i] > 0) {
                          if (degs[i] < min_deg) {
                              min_deg = degs[i];
                              candidate = i;
                          } else if (degs[i] == min_deg) {
                              if (i < candidate) {
                                  candidate = i;
                              }
                          }
                      }
                  }

                  // Find the smallest neighbor of candidate
                  int min_neighbor = 10000000;
                  for (int i = 0; i < sizes[candidate]; i++) {
                      if (edges[candidate][i] < min_neighbor) {
                          min_neighbor = edges[candidate][i];
                      }
                  }

                  int X = min_neighbor + 1;

                  // Free graph memory
                  for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
                      free(edges[i]);
                  }
                  free(edges);
                  free(sizes);
                  free(capacities);
                  free(degs);

                  // Find next prime >= X

                      if (prime[i]) {
                          printf("%d\n", i);
                          return 0;
                      }
